reviews.text: Let’s start with the fact that there’s 24/7 free coffee ☕️. It’s a great Irish inspired hotel, central to all the DC attractions making it a great spot if you’re up for a day of walking. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and well kept. Possibly the best part is the attached pub that reminds me of the pubs I visited in Ireland a few months prior. You’ll get a good pint of Guinness and it even has the same scent as the pubs in Ireland. A great choice for a weekend in DC. Can’t forget about the speedy valet service as well! Highly recommended.

My friend and I stayed here when we were going to be in DC for a concert. The room was small, but perfect for what we needed. The room was clean and the bathroom was gorgeous. Staff at all times were friendly and helpful. It was about a 15 minute walk to Capital One Arena and you were so close to the Capital Building you could see it! Very enjoyable stay, I would come back. They even have a super cool latte machine that can be used for free as a guest!

This is a GREAT hotel to stay in if you are visiting Washington DC. It’s small enough to give you very personal service. The bellmen hailed cabs quickly and cheerfully. The housekeeping service was daily! They worked around our schedule with no problem. One night, we had noisy neighbors. When we called, the staff took care of it immediately. We were there six nights. The breakfast a la cart was very reasonable. $7 for made to order eggs and bacon. Great French Toast! The Dubliner, connected to the hotel, was great if you wanted dinner quickly. Great location not far from the sites and close to union station. We would definitely stay again.

Stayed here for a belated birthday weekend in D.C.. The entire staff was so kind and helpful. Beds were amazing and the rooms were very clean. Views from our room were really pretty, and the complimentary coffee/espresso bar was extremely convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The only downside is the surrounding location is a little bit sketchy. Lots of homeless people at night, some seemed to be clearly mentally ill. This is no fault of the hotel though.

First thing first this place was cute and inviting. The staff always said good morning and good evening. The bed was super comfy the pillows were like sleeping on clouds. The water was super hot like which was a relief from the cold as we went in January. The dubliner restaurant had delicious breakfast and late night dinner. I would go back again.

Absolutely amazing spot!!!! The service was incredible. The good was amazing!!! Catfish entree with Jalapeño grits and collards......A MUST! Sweet potato pancakes......A MUST! The lattes are pretty tasty. The ambience and music were really cool. The most shoebox thing is being able to read and so for books in the same space. I can't wait to come back.

As soon as you step foot inside the restaurant you are captured by the design and layout. The books that they have out for display are very interesting. Then, you have the food. I only had the shrimp and grits, but the other meals caught my attention so much that I need to go back.

My group is visiting from Ohio for a conference. The restaurant is pleasingly eclectic in its decor. The atmosphere was quaint. The server was pleasant and smile with authenticity as she assisted the three of us. The food was served hot and was pleasing plated. The taste of the good was amazing. The seasoning of the catfish, greens and cheddar and jalapeño grits was perfect. I could eat here every day.

I love the idea of this place!! They sell books! It's amazing!! The artwork is powerful and speaks volumes without spoken words. I came here with a group for my scholarship and we got a whole from to ourselves. It's a very big place with multiple rooms and a huge outdoor patio. Service was great and everyone was friendly and helpful. The ART tho 😍🤩🙌

I absolutely loved it here! I loved how the staff were just having a good time and jamming out to music while working. The girl behind the bar was living her best life with the music. The whole place has a fantastic vibe and great food. We came for brunch but I'm sure dinner is just as great!

We tried the set menu and so worth it. The food is great, and the chefs present Indian food with a modern take but still keep the amazing authentic flavors in the dishes. But the service is hands down the best in town. The staff are very professional, friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming, especially Gustavo who we had a pleasure to met with during our first dinner experience in Rasika a couple of days ago. It’s always a bit competitive to get a table there but a must go to restaurant in DC, especially if you love food with a lot of flavors

LOVE this place! The food is great, the staff is great, ambiance is great. The dishes are a modern twist in terms of flavors, textures and appearance. Yet still heavily connected to the inspiration, so you will know what you are eating. Our favorite was the palak (spinach) dish. Could not take a photo as we were hungry and just dug into the food. The Naan (bread) was like a buttery cloud you would want to sleep on. If you dine-in, you can get multiple small portions of the entree to try out different menu options, which is what we did. We loved the food so much that we ate here 4 times out of our 3 day stay in the area!

Excellent Indian restaurant. Whenever I come to Washington DC, Rasika is on my stop list. Last 5 years, I have not had any bad dishes. You can order anything from the menu and it will taste delicious.

I have been wanting to visit here for several years. I wanted to get the tasting menu, but I went with someone who is non veg, so I tried 4 vegetable side curries and the bread basket instead. Asparagus was very good. Eggplant was tasty, but a bit too spicy for my liking. Malai kofta had delicious dumplings, but the sauce was bitter. Zucchini fritters were very dry, but the curry was excellent. I ended up eating just the sauce with the bread. Breads were all great. Service was fantastic. Loved the inside ambiance, the patio space, and the silverware.

The best Indian food I have ever had, do not forget to order/specially go there for the Gujarati lasagne (it literally blew my mind by how balanced and wholesome it was!). Their purple potato dosa was a family favorite. The staff was very sweet and loving and the service was fast and great.

Great fillet mignon center steak! Awesome oyster, so fresh and I particularly love the sour red sauce that comes with it. I think it is tomato based.

We asked for medium for the new york stripe but it was a bit too dry. Asparagus was splendid, perfectly cooked. Atmosphere was nice too.

Ok so we were excited to experience this place for our anniversary. Sadly we was highly disappointed. 1st we were shoved in a corner that wasn't comfortable especially with me being 8 months pregnant, and when I asked the hostess can we have another seat placement she just looked at me as if I spoke another language.  The service was subpar. It was too many times during our meal the waiter didn't show back up for long periods and we were left waiting looking crazy. The food was ok, steak was great the bearnaise sauce was horrible, mushrooms were too tough to chew. I was hoping you at least get a complimentary dessert for our anniversary and we did not get anything except a meal that wasn't enjoyable. The ambiance was however nice. Would I be back...most likely not.

I had a great experience. I ordered the lobster linguini and it was absolutely delicious. I also had to have asparagus and it was cooked perfectly and great flavors. I had a few servers: Gustavo, Rodrigo, and 2/3 more. The service was spot on. I was taken care of. I would come back for the environment, music, service, and food.

I decided to try CPSH and to my delight it was amazing! The staff truly make the experience memorable. You must try their trio crème brûlée Exceptional
Ohhhhhh and the French onion soup…… on point
Great place for business lunch. I got the crab cakes and it was amazing! More filling than i thought. I'd like to return and try their steaks.

Nice restaurant in D.C.. The cocktails and the calamari was a really good way to start. I had the shrimp scampi and it was delicious. The pasta was perfectly cooked and definitely a must try. My friends enjoyed their entrées as well. I love the feel of the restaurant. Nice lighting and interior with a nice bar as well. The service was nice and efficient. Highly recommend this place.

Clyde's was on point as usual. I got there around 11:30 on a Sunday morning and by the time I left an hour later the restaurant was packed (the bar had the World Cup final on TV). Great food and an awesome cocktail made my lunch amazing. I got a grilled chicken sandwich and the A-Pear-ently It's Fall drink. Jasmine, my server, also brought a small wedge of warm crumb cake. Delicious!! First floor has a bar and dining area, but the second floor is where everything happens. Another bar, tons of booths and tables, and there's even an indoor patio area. Jasmine was the best, she took very good care of me and made sure I had everything I needed. Check out Clyde's for a casual, laid back dining experience.

I have come to Clyde's every time I come to DC and decided to have my birthday brunch here today.  It didn't disappoint. The service staff was attentive and polite.  I opened with mussels and had the lump crab cake as an entree.  Both were gorgeous and delicious. I finished with a blackberry shortcake.  Highly recommended.

We went around 11pm on a Thursday. It was crowded. We went too late to be seated by a hostess but we were allowed to sit at a booth in the bar area. We ordered food from the late night menu. The crab and artichoke dip was just right. It wasn’t oily. The chili was delicious with the sour cream and cheese. The crab Cake was tasty. We would go back again.

We were from out of town and decided to catch a hockey game. Unfortunately it didn't occur to us that finding a place to eat before the game would be so hard. We walked into Clydes and it was mobbed. At least an hour wait and we had 2 young children. However the manager on duty saw our struggle and managed to seat us right away. Amazing customer service and I'd give 5 stars just for that!

Food was delicious and service was top notch. Go here.

The service here is quick and friendly staff. Our host was excellent and give us some brief explanations and suggestions what to order. She did not rushed us when we order. Although it was a bit of wait to get a table for 6 person, it was worth the wait. Food were delicious and authentic Mexican. Prices are reasonable. Will come back here for our next DC visit.

Enjoyed dinner. Loved the fun energetic atmosphere. We made reservations here for dinner. Loved that the chips and salsa were complimentary and placed on our table when we sat down. The guacamole was really good. I had the enchiladas and my husband had a chicken taco and a beef taco. Everything was good. Service was great.

My family and I traveled from Atlanta and while walking around DC we came across this gem. Our server was Joanna and she was great at taking care of us and made us feel comfortable! Had knowledge on any questions we had, which was a plus! We were beyond pleased with the food, drinks, desserts and the pleasant atmosphere!!!
Definitely went above and beyond our expectations, with great authentic Mexican dishes. We couldn’t have been happier, we look forward to coming back in the future! Greatly recommend!!! It’s a must try.

The food is quite tasty. When we visited, though, the service was a bit uneven. The food seemed to rush out, but our server would disappear for long stretches. We highly recommend the guacamole. It was yummy, but we ordered it spicy and it came out mild. The chips and salsa were excellent.  We also had t cevice and Vera Cruz tuna tacos.  Both were great.

Definitely worth a visit. We had a great evening here. The server was kind and friendly. The food was amazing. They bring you warm chips and salsa, which are great. We tried two different margaritas. The Serrano Margarita was a spicy delicious kick in the face :) The Al Gusto was good as well. All 3 tacos were excellent. Really well done. And the place feels reasonably priced. The decor is super eclectic and fun as well, butterflies everywhere. We would highly recommend this place.

Wonderful Sunday brunch experience. We were seated almost immediately. Right away you notice the patio area, welcoming ambiance, great lightning, and a beautiful decor.

Our server, Victor, was amazing and spot-on with his recommendations. We decided to go with the Chef 3 Course Brunch meal, generous amount of food for the price.
I wanted to highlight the Chicken and Waffles, great balance between sweet and spicy. The Strawberry Cinnamon Roll was delicious, not too overwhelming. Our meal also included the Steak and Egg entire, can't go wrong and everything was perfectly cooked and seasoned.

Definitely a great place for brunch, good food, great service, and a laid back atmosphere.

Stopped and had brunch here. The restaurant was big and fancy clean looking on the inside…but they have a big outside area that we had our eyes on.

Food was great! We sampled a number of their brunch options that were all great…with us loving the biscuits and gravy the best!

Their chocolate raspberry tart was pretty darn good too! I would order it again.

The only thing that sucked was the staff, managers and a table of 15 were all fighting over how many tables they could occupy. At first it was… a bit … entertaining… but it kept dragging on and it was clear the situation was bumming everyone out… so we just left.

Would recommend! Would try the place again :)

Had a delicious brunch here..had to make  reservations on resy and it was relatively busy. Outside seating is nice on a summer day. our waiter was great at recommending the top brunch meals. I enjoyed the steak and eggs which came with potatoes..my friend thought the short rib was okay but could have used a bit more seasoning.
We also go a bottle of mimosa and a Caesar salad for starters. In all, worth the visit!

The food here was incredible and I highly recommend the crab deviled eggs along with the short rib hash. They have a variety of options for those that are vegetarian and vegan as well.

I listed my review with 4/5 stars because the customer service from the host stand and the lack of communication from them as well left our wonderful server in a bit of hurry towards the end of our meal. I'm not sure if the hosts were new or just didn't care but it definitely showed.

Overall the food reviews are what brought me to this location and we will absolutely be back for another round.

Make sure to get a seat on the patio!

I took my husband here for a birthday brunch and our waiter Victor impressed us both. He made great recommendations in addition to excellent service. The food was absolutely phenomenal and the cinnamon roll was delightful. They even brought my husband out a nice candle and a dessert! We will definitely be going back here. Excellent food, excellent service, and cool atmosphere.

DELICIOUS!! Glad I tried this place out. Must say, this is pretty good chicken that tastes freshly made. Mobile ordering at the table is available, or you could order at the counter. Menu has many options for you to pick from, from bowls to chicken breasts, even, sandwiches! Staff were friendly and accommodating. Just wish they had a bigger dessert menu. But, overall, I still plan to return. Must try!!

I have been wanting to try Nando’s for a very very long time. Finally!

We ordered the whole chicken and the wings. We also tried the custard tarts for dessert. I am not really a fan of the custard. They are ordinary for me. But the chicken and the sauces… those are a different story.

I can understand the craze and hype about Nando’s and how they franchised so quickly. I cannot even find the right words to describe it. The chicken is halal, I believe, which is why it’s also a hit for our Muslim brothers. The chicken is very tender and has the right amount of flavor that will complement any sauce you choose. From mild to extremely hot, you can dip or drown the chicken in any sauces and finish it to the bones.

Ordering and paying is through their website or app. Make sure you put your table number if you are dining in and they will serve your order in 10-20 minutes. You do not need to buzz your table after eating. The staff will do that for you. Hence, you need to tip. You have to get your own sauces, utensils, and fountain drink/water though.

I have tried their juice as well. I think I ordered something with a pineapple orange and it is very refreshing. Sweet but refreshing.

Credit cards accepted. For this location, and most establishments nearby (that I have noticed), there is security present.

Portuguese is on of my favorite cuisines, I was so happy to be in Washington D.C. and see a great chain of a Portuguese restaurant every where in D.C.
we ordered chicken, dessert and garlic bread. The chicken and the garlic bread were SO delicious. I hope they can open in NJ or in NY. Also the place was pleasant and they have a big area of different seating.

The chicken was so delicious with a variety of spice options; we chose lime and hot options. They have much indoor seating. For drinks option they have Portuguese beer and wine! As well as other non alcoholic beverages. They have pasteis de Nata. The staff is friendly. Also they are very clean and keep covid precaution practices. After each person leaves, I noticed they cleaned the table right away. They also have contactless food ordering by scanning the barcode and ordering online with payment. I really loved coming here and hope to return again in the future.

First time for Persian chicken and will definitely be back! The chicken bowl was delicious. The plentiful options for sauces made the experience so much fun. Love that they bring the food to you vs standing at counter waiting for your order. The only thing I would change is to have wait staff come to your table vs standing in line to order.

So I came all the way from Vegas to have a great time with friends, and we made plans to eat at union pub. The atmosphere was nice, but unfortunately the dining experience differed. We had a party of 8 and they couldn't get anyone's order to the right place and they forgot to bring out requested items. This is not a fan fave and I recommend that you save your coins if you can or try something else!!!

Nice outdoor seating area with overhead canopy and some side plexiglass wind protection, but still good air flow. Black bean veggie burger and salad was good option for me as a vegan (minus cheese, of course), and craft beer selection was decent. Or server was attentive and helpful. Alas, the TVs showing a football game were unfortunately quite loud, even after we requested reduced sound level. Oh well. Guessing that doesn't happen all the time. Great location near Union Station Metro and Capitol Hill.

This was the worst experience at a restaurant I’ve ever had. Waiter was very inattentive and seemed agitated when we made simply requests, like that he bring us some clean glasses to drink from instead of dirty ones covered in fingerprints. One of my friends ordered the black bean burger with only lettuce and they brought it to her with no bun….. Just the patty and a piece of lettuce….. Food wasn’t good at all. I had the chicken sliders and was not impressed. Only ate two of the four. Fries were flavorless. The old bay wings were poorly seasoned as well. Chair legs and table legs were both uneven so we were pretty much wobbling the entire time we were trying to eat. Will never be dining here again. 0/5, would NOT recommend! Take your money somewhere else!

Wow the old grumpy barmaid was really rude.  The old lady with white long hair.  She snatched my Visa up and then demanded I sign it. Rude the whole time.  Yelled at me and said other half of bar was closed.  But I was just going to restroom.  Will never be back and tell everyone In DC my experience

Any place with sweet potato fries is already thumbs up for me. Aside from that, the staff was present, and friendly. The food was seasoned just right, and I loved the portions served.

We sat on the patio around lunchtime, which looked like it was used for extra storage space in some sections. A little crowded, the tables and chairs could probably be arranged to better utilize the space, or just use less of them in the space.

Fine Dining! Initially I misjudged The Capital Grille as a normal place to get a burger sure to the word Grille being part of their name. However the reviews said otherwise. My wife and I went and were pleased to find they offer a romantic fine dining experience with an excellent menu. My wife ordered the Double Cut Lamb Rib Chops and loved them. The added mint made them something extra special. I ordered one of the bone in steaks and wasn't disappointed. The size of my steak was more than what I could eat and it was cooked just right. I recommend The Capitol Grille for anyone passing through who wants an excellent meal.

Absolutely wonderful! The new location is great and the inside is very nice with fun artwork. We celebrated Mother’s Day and had an excellent meal and our server, Miguel was so friendly and accommodating! He made the experience great. The food was delicious and the favorites were the filet & lobster tail, lobster mac and cheese and Brussel sprouts! For dessert, the cheesecake was amazing! We will be back for the next celebration!

We went for dinner tonight to celebrate our anniversary, and had THE best meal. I had the steak and lobster tails, my spouse had the bone-in ribeye. Everything was very well seasoned and flavorful, our steaks had the perfect temperature we had asked for, great experience. Our waiter was the best part of the night, Carlos, he was so so very helpful and friendly, we made friends with him. He made sure we had a great experience. Loved everything about this place!

I proposed to my girlfriend here and it was the best service here. The steaks were good, the waiters was a good person, the wine was good, and the soup too. After I propose, we got really good tasting desert. Be prepared to spend money, but it is worth the price. I hope to go there again for our future wedding anniversary.

Recommend making reservations if visiting on a weekend. Had a great time service was  wonderful they were able to accommodate 2 more seats for our party, even on a busy night. Entrees are a la carte good section of sides, not so much for desert, but they have a  nice wine list.

name: Fiola
vicinity: entrance on Indiana Ave, 601 Pennsylvania Avenue Northwest, Washington

reviews.text: Stepping into Fiola is stepping into refined and elegant world. Every detail in this place  oozes with taste, warmth and elegance. The menu is rather limited but the dishes are carefully and artistically made. Mason our waiter was amazing. Thank you for a pricy yet wonderful experience.

THANK YOU Fiola for making my birthday so lovely and special! An experience and memories I’ll always cherish! THE MOST amazing food, you simply have to stop here while in DC.
Wonderful service from the moment you walk in. Our server, Mason, was highly knowledgeable about the wine list and very personable as well. Each course was beautifully crafted, it’s clear how much work and dedication went into each and every aspect of dinner. Thank you again Chef Fabio and the entire Fiola team!

So far the best michelin tried in the DMV area. From making modifications to my large party to the modification for me of no sheep's milks, which ended up modifying multiple courses, this restaurant was above accommodatable and amazing. First I'd have to give a shout out to the management staff, Sarah S was so helpful and nice and has a great demeanor, and Giuseppe was also amazing and assisted us with ending our bills and making white truffle recommendations. We tried the 9 course option which everyone raved about. 1 felt if we went for the 5 course, maybe it would have been a different experience and a few did not like the citrus flavor for the lobster entree meal, but every other course was so amazing. I'd recommend for sure to add on the white truffle and gnocchi pasta course as it was the highlight of everyone's night, as was the tiramisu. Definitely a place to visit again (this being said by someone who doesn't normally eat Italian food either!). Thank you Fiola!

Without a doubt the best meal I've ever had. I went a couple of years ago while in DC for a conference. I had some sort of prefixed chef's tasting menu that had 7 or 8 courses, all paired with wine. it was amazing and I can't wait to go back.
The first course was almost too much for me to try. I usually don't eat raw meat, and the first course was a raw oyster topped with wagyu beef tartare, then topped again with caviar. While I was not used to the texture, the flavor was absolute art.
The seafood, meat, sides, sauces, all the way to the garnish was all masterful and delicious.
It took several people to create, present, and deliver the meal to the table. It was like watching a show unfold. The server was very knowledgeable about everything served and we were lucky he was also a sommelier. This made it even more interesting as he presented the wine that was served with each course.
I can't recommend this place enough. It was just honored as the #2 Italian restaurant in the world that's outside of Italy. Do yourself a favor and go ready to spend whatever it takes to get the full experience.

Dinner here was exceptional. Service staff was amazing. We did the harvest menu where you get to pick 4 items yourself and the chef picks the others for you. We had not one complaint. Every dish was delicious. Some of our favorites were the Eggplant Mousse, Langoustine, Childhood(Pasta), Farmers Steak(Wagyu)& the Sweet Beginnings(Pumpkin Spice "Latte," Honeynut Squash Gelato). It felt like by the end of the night we must of had 15+ dishes. Oh and the cocktails! Such an experience. Highly recommend ordering their specialty cocktails. It is like nothing you’ve experience before! Super creative & fun. Needless to say, you definitely get your moneys worth and will not leave hungry or unhappy. It was an amazing experience and we can’t wait to go back next time we’re in D.C.!

We love Hill Country and the food is consistently good each visit. One caveat for this visit though, I remember the Mac and cheese being a lot better than what it was this particular evening. It was still good but maybe it wasn’t as good as I remembered. There was a hockey game in the city tonight and this was a good treat before game time. The restaurant had good seating and the bar area had plenty of seats left. Overall I really enjoy the food and would go back for sure!

Get transported to a wild west canteen with good food. Yeah why, not. I'll take it. The atmosphere is really nice and relaxed. The canteen style actually works and is efficient, so you get the food from the counter and sit anywhere you like. The meat was good, roughly what I expected. So I can't complain. The price might be a bit high for what it is. I'm giving 5 stars because with the potential of live music, this place has potential and can be very lively.

Now this is BBQ!! I was a bit concerned when my pal said DC had good BBQ, but after this visit, I owed him a “you were right!” Big spaces, nice tables and a full bar. The food was just amazing. Friendly staff and we never went without our glasses full. Somehow I was able to eat a whole brisket sandwich, beans with burnt ends, and two cornbread muffins. This was the best food I had in DC the whole week.

Great Texas BBQ in the heart of DC.  The service here is topnotch.  We were greeted warmly and shown to a table right away.  We were also asked if we had dined at Hill Country before and when we said we had not, the hostess politely informed us of how the ordering process works, which was really helpful.  The staff preparing the meat were friendly and engaged us in conversation while they prepared our plates.  There are several types of meat to choose from....brisket, sausage, chicken, etc.  All were really good.  The chicken was more moist than almost any other bbq place I have visited in DC and Texas.  They have every side you can think of as well.  I highly recommend the bourbon mashed sweet potato, chili, and deviled eggs.  The cornbread is pretty good too....honey butter is delish.  They offer margarita pitchers, which are really good, just be sure to sit in the bar area if you want to take advantage of the happy hour specials.  They also have another large dance club space in the basement, where it looks like they have live bands.  Overall, we had a great time and would comeback.  Thanks!

First-time eating here and let me tell you it won't be the last. The food was amazing the brisket was moist, the chicken was good, and the ribs amazing. The side was good to the mac and cheese, sweet potatoes, and greens. Some of the best BBQ I had in a while.

We went there during restaurant week for brunch. Everything was good, the food was delicious, the atmosphere was great. Our server was friendly and on time. I love it there and would go back for sure. The only reason I gave it 4 was because our server told us the champaign is $40 and he would give us some orange juice so we can make mimosa for ourself, however when the bill came, he charged us $56! When we asked why $56, he said $40 was the bottle the rest was the service for the Champagne and glasses and orange juice! I didn’t argue just because he was nice and the food was good otherwise I would have asked for manager.
Spacious and quiet place that's very nice for business meetings. I really enjoyed their steak tartare, one of the best I've had. The service was attentive and polite and food was served pretty fast.

We had the $25 prix fixe menu for restaurant week and it was amazing! The staff was very kind and the indoor decoration felt very luxurious. The service was quite prompt as well. We had made a reservation in advance so we didn't have to wait.

Had an amazing time here! The food was delicious and definitely had great portions. I had the duck and friends had other entrees - everyone loved what they ordered. Beautiful atmosphere and decorum here. I will say, my visit was extra special as two young people decided to spend forever with each other. The man was definitely happy the woman said Yes and the restaurant shared in their happiness. Beautiful scene, encourage others to come by. Parking will be on the street - stop by a few minutes early just in case you have a small walk.
The staff at Bistro Bis are top notch AMAZING! Everything I ate was so delicious and so were the drinks as well. I will definitely return to dinner here Every time I'm in DC.

Quick here and a lot of choices. The pizza is good as is the hot food but  a little expensive- especially when they are weighing pastas and sauces. The lemon chicken is my favorite and is really good when it is fresh! They have both round and aware pizza but the Square is not really that thick.  There is not a lot of seating here and sometimes it appears a little messy. There are healthy choices including salad and fruit which are on the food bar.
Good food and friendly service. The two guys sleeping in the dining area detracted from a wholly positive experience.

No more stuffed pizza. It was my favorite growing up. I asked if they make it still and they said they discontinued over the Summer of 2022.

Only place left is Arundel Mills Sbarro that has it.
As a Pizza Specialist, this Sbarro aint never let me down.

I was greeted by Carlos who was busy prepping when I walked into the Sbarro. The selection on breakfast menu items was listed. It was a nice healthy selection so I ordered eggs,potatoes and a biscuit.I'm vegetarian. I was asked if i was dining in or taking out.The food well done was placed into an aluminum pan and given to me on a tray as I chose to dine in. The price was a bit costly I added an apple juice and my total was 9.44. If it was not for the great customer service I would have walked out but food is expensive anyway so I had no problem paying. The quality of the food was what I expected and it was a pretty decent breakfast as I was feeling a bit sick before consumption and it helped make me feel better

The Sangria Hour is well worth it, as the cocktails and tapas are well priced. Tapas portions are large and shareable among friends that want to sample a few dishes. Classic flavours and quality you can count on. Dishes are not terribly creative, but the service is quick with minimalist communication.

My future wife and I went to Jaleo for restaurant week and also to meet with our potential wedding planner. I love the vibe of this restaurant and their staff. The sangria was awesome. My Fiancé enjoyed it. It was a 5 course meal with small tapas but at the end we were extremely full. Each persons meal was $40 during restaurant week. The bacon wrapped dates were awesome. We went to this restaurant 3 years ago so it was nostalgic. The dessert was probably my favorite pan chocolate. The waiter did a great job.

This place is so good.  I have been to the one in Chicago for happy hour and was excited to get a reservation here for dinner.  We did the $80/pp tasting experience and it was so worth it.  I don't eat pork and the chef was able to customize for me.  We had amazing service and the food was so delicious.  I loved the tasting because it allowed us to try so many things.

Fantastic experience overall with excellent service. Our bartender/server gave us great suggestions and the drinks were fantastic as well.

We were happy with every dish we received with one exception (our salad had mealy apple bits in it that detracted from the experience) and the octopus was cooked perfectly. Will happily return in the future.

During a recent trip to DC, I ate a few Michelin starred restaurants. However, it was the atmosphere and flavors of Jaleo that I can’t forget.
While the service was a little cold and mechanical, the drinks and menu well made up for it.
I ordered a plate from each of their categories and was shocked at the hefty portion sizes. This is not your average tapas plate size.
My absolute favorites were the Iberico, potato salad with roe, and the endive orange bites.

Definitely order a sherry cocktail from the bar!

My husband and I came here for our Valentine’s Day dinner and we were pleasantly surprised! The food here is so delicious! I can’t believe I never stopped in this restaurant before! The spinach dip was amazing! Like we were (shamefully) scraping the plate 😂😂🤦🏾‍♀️ The steaks, equally delicious and cooked perfectly! It was extremely busy, but our waiter remained attentive and served us pretty quickly considering how crazy it was. I’m definitely coming back to this restaurant for dinner again. Very, very good!

Fantastic place to eat brunch at. We got all appetizers and they were simply divine. The fried calamari came with some pickles which added to the flavor nicely. The shrimp cocktail and the crab dip were also superb. Also, the staff was super friendly! Would definitely come to eat here again if I visit DC again!

Went here for a birthday celebration. It served about 20 people at one time. Service was as good as it could be serving a number like this. The cornbread skillet was delicious. Everyone reaved about the lamb. I got the burger which was filling. I would return to try this place again.

Service was great send food was delicious.  I got there around 5pm for an early dinner.  The staff was marvelous, and extremely friendly.  The French Onion Soup had a bit of tang I wasn't used to but other than that everything was pretty standard fare

Very good steaks particularly the bone-in rib eye. Loved the corn bread. The cheesecake was a bit too sweet to my liking. The staff was professional and friendly. Definitely a place I'd come back to for dinner when in Washington.

name: Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Washington D.C.
vicinity: 425 7th Street NW at, E Street Northwest, Washington

reviews.text: The portion size of this place is HUGE! Good thing is they serve lunch sizes all day for certain items. Lasagna wasn’t one of those so this was definitely dinner and lunch for the next day. Food wasn’t bad, however, you could taste that everything basically comes from a can. Taste a lot like chef boyardee. Drinks were a bit too sweet but not terrible. The highlight was their garlic bread! Now that was amazing!!!! I could just sit, eat that, and be extremely satisfied

Looking for an Italian food in the downtown area, and found this decent Italian restaurant. Overall, we had a great dining experience. The server was very friendly and professional, she started by explaining a few things about the restaurant and told us that the food is supposed to be shared by 2-3 people per portion. Foods taste great and the price is reasonable.

Conveniently located family share style Italian restaurant. Made a reservation for 8 and they accommodated an unexpected add on with no issue through the reservation system. Was seated promptly with drinks and food served very quickly. Probably best garlic bread I've ever had. Drinks were delicious and strong. Tried a variety of dishes with the huge servings. Very comfortable setting and could easily hear everyone at the table even with it being busy and lively music being played. Would like to go back as soon as possible.

Great food, however for less than 3 or 4 people not well suited. The only regular tables are available for a menu that only serves family-sizes. So if you go there alone as I did, you either have tons of leftovers or ruin every diet you’re on - also, whatever you order apart from drinks comes multiplied by 4 basically and costs accordingly. So ordering a simple garlic bread sets you back 15 USD and you get like 9 pieces. No issue if you sit at the bar to get human-sized portions, however it tainted the experience a little. Nonetheless, the food was gorgeous and the staff great!

Excellent Italian restaurant! We had a great dining experience. The server was very friendly and professional, she started by explaining a few things about the restaurant and told us that the food is supposed to be shared by 2-3 people per portion. Foods taste great and the price is reasonable.

I have never had a sublime turkey burger until I went here. Half a pound patties on toasted brioche buns with a side of thick cut fries. Great spot to hit a spot for pub food. The fries were a tad overly seasoned for my taste but I was thoroughly impressed by the burger of the day and the bison burger. Okay service. Restaurant is connected to a hotel in the back. Outdoor patio seating available. Nice atmosphere even though music was a bit too loud at times to converse.

Great place! The food is tasty and flavorful. The portions are big. The decoration is amazing. The waiters are attentive and can give you tips on how to navigate your way around the city. You can sit down, relax, and enjoy your food while listening to some beautiful Irish songs.

Had a delicious 'Capitol Hill Burger' for dinner one night and I can't complain about it. The staff were so friendly. The only issue you might have with the place is that it can get quite loud inside during the evening due to large groups of friends having a good time (can't blame them) in addition to the occasional live music performances. Personally I enjoyed the bustling atmosphere. 4 stars.

Incredible experience. The staff was extremely accommodating, saw the manager help a family out and merge several tables together for a family reunion even though it was clear that was not the norm. We only had an hour to catch our train and they rushed the order in the kitchen.

Food was simply divine, service was amazing, staff lovely, and the prices right.

Would have labeled this as 2 $$, updated menu attached (their website was incorrect), but otherwise simply lovely!

Great breakfast and spot to grab a bite before catching a train at union station. Thanks to our waiter and kitchen team. We mentioned we had a train to catch and asked if we had enough time. They said yes, kept us updated on progress and hit the mark.

One of the greatest dining experiences I've ever had.

the atmosphere, service, food, and drink selection is impeccable.  I dinned over the weekend, and told them I was vegan, and they went above and beyond to fit my dietary restrictions.  They custom made me my own pesto, and adjusted 2 menu items to accommodate.

The pizza they made - was probably the best pizza I've ever had in my life.  the crust was so fresh, as well as the tomatoes and greens that were on top.  it had the snap of toasted crust but a soft bready inside - with the most intense fire roasted brick oven flavor.  absolutely incredible 11 out of 10.

the restaurant itself is super open and clean, and has a warm vibe to it.  if ur in DC - this is a must stop.

The place is nice and the staff very kind!  However we were a little disappointed with the food.  The steak was very fatty and the duck floated in the gravy.  Plus they both arrived cold.  Pity.  The wine list is interesting.  I don't think we'll be back.

Hi during this week which is restaurant week. First entry was watermelon salad. AMAZING. Shrimp scamp for 2nd course. And 3rd course (I can’t believe I ate it all lol), butter beer homemade ice cream.

This restaurant is exquisite. Chef Mel is amazing, he understood my dietary needs and my meal was delicious he even gave me some of the special sauce from my meal to take home.

I must say the front of the house is wonderful also, Juan, Stephen, Jose and Jordan.

Although it had been years since I last visited, I joined some friends here for dinner the weekend after Thanksgiving and had a lovely time. We got the rose and red wine flights and had fun trying each of the very distinct offerings. The food is delicious - we shared the gnocchi, pan seared salmon, and chicken piccata panini. Highly recommend stopping by! There is also private event space available on their second floor.

Small place, very clean with friendly staff.
The seaweed salad was pretty good. But the sushi here was really delicious. Very fresh fish/seafood, large portions, flavors were really good. Service was pretty quick, as we were finishing our rolls they would bring more. Highly recommend.
Interested to try their happy hour sushi.

Delicious food, great prices, fast service, small and cozy restaurant. I'll come here again when I visit Washington DC. Its very popular, lots of guests and people in line waiting for a table.

We ate Pho/noodle soup  it was soon good. My kids at sushi and the loved it. Come here, you won't be disappointed.

The ambience of this restaurant was pretty good, making us feel like travel outside of DC briefly. Brussels sprouts and sushi roll were good/acceptable. Ramen was not very authentic, and the ingredients felt a bit cheap. Overall, I might consider ordering items except ramen in this restaurant if I ever come back.

The cheapest and best tasting sushi you can order around the National Mall. They have amazing happy hour options with several pieces of Nigri ranging from $1-3. They also have medium fatty and fatty tuna options at market price. The service was quick, and I enjoyed the outdoor seating. I left extremely satisfied and would highly recommend visiting this restaurant.

Go here instead of Kura Revolving Sushi. There was no wait on a Saturday evening at 6 pm. The service was great and food reasonably priced. Sushi was great. We had 4 roles, 1 appetizer, 1 chicken teriyaki entree, and 3 sides for about $100. Pretty good for DC. I recommended it!
